text: “ DT folksiness will irk some critics … But criticizing Friedman for humanizing and boiling down big topics is IN complaining IN Mick Jagger used sex to sell songs : PRP is what he does well . ” – John Micklethwait , review of Thank PRP for Being Late , in DT NNP York Times With apologies to Mr. Micklethwait , DT hands WDT typed these lines implying Thomas Friedman is a Mick Jagger of letters should be chopped off and mailed to DT singer ’s doorstep in penance . Mick Jagger MD excite DT NN in CD note , while Thomas Friedman needs 461 pages to say , “ Shit happens . ” Joan of Arc and Charles Manson had more in common . Thomas Friedman was once a man of great influence . His columns were must - reads for every senator and congressperson . He helped spread DT globalization gospel and push PRP into war in Iraq . But he ’s destined now to be more famous as a literary figure . No modern writer has been lampooned more . Hundreds if not thousands of man-hours have been spent teaching robots to produce automated Friedman - prose , in what collectively is a half - vicious , half - loving tribute to a man who raised bad writing to DT level of an art form . PRP will remember Friedman for interviewing 76 percent of DT NN ’s taxi drivers , for predicting “ DT next six months will be critical ” on 14 occasions over two and a half NNS ( birthing DT neologism , “ DT Friedman unit “ ) , and for his unmatched , God - given ability to write nonsensical metaphors , IN his classic “ rule of holes ” : “ When PRP ’re in CD , stop digging . When PRP ’re in three , bring a lot of shovels . ” Friedman ’s great anti-gift is his ability to use JJ words when only a few are necessary . He became famous as a newspaper columnist for taking simple CD - sentence observations IN , “ Wow , everyone has a cell phone these days , ” and blowing them out into furious 850 - word trash - fires of mismatched imagery and circular argument . DT double - axel version of this feat was to then rewrite DT same column over and over again , in DT same newspaper , only piling on more incongruous imagery and skewing rhetoric to further stoke DT CD thought into an even higher and angrier fire . For nearly two decades now , Friedman has been telling PRP IN something big is happening , technology is growing at a rate beyond DT ability of humans to adapt ( this is where DT part about noticing everyone has a cell phone comes in ) , and IN PRP have to stop doing things DT old way and take a brave step into DT future . He wrote this column so JJ times IN even four NNS ago – eight Friedman units – Hamilton Nolan wrote a piece in Gawker titled “ Thomas Friedman writes his only column again ” ( Friedman ’s “ only column ” has by now outlived hundreds of NN outlets , Gawker and my own NNP York Press among them ) . Nolan cited a piece in DT Times called “ DT Rise of Popularism , ” in which Friedman argued , again , IN technology was racing past humanity ’s ability to govern itself wisely . A very conservative guess is IN Friedman has written this column at least a hundred times . Maybe 200 . Maybe more . If PRP ’re rolling your eyes at this , check yourself . VB about what an awesome accomplishment WDT is . PRP takes an extraordinary discipline to turn CD sentence of thought into hundreds of thousands of words . PRP all repeat ourselves in DT punditry business . Most of PRP only have a few ideas . Friedman has fewer than most – PRP ’s really just CD , technology future derp ! – but he ’s attacked IN CD idea with such relentless evangelical NN WDT he is leaving behind as a monument to PRP DT literary equivalent of DT Giza pyramid complex . This decades - long gigantic art project is based upon a vast architecture of needless complication , a process he describes in this JJ book of his , Thank PRP for Being Late , as “ translating English into English . ” Build a sentence into a column ; build a column into JJ columns ; build JJ columns into a book ; build CD book into JJ books . Then start over ! Eleven NNS ago , when Friedman wrote his seminal explainer book , DT NNP is Flat – a book whose title metaphor was hilariously based on DT wrong premise IN NNS are more interconnected on a flat NN than on a round CD – he combined two giant sets of metaphors to describe DT same idea IN technology was outpacing our ability to govern ourselves . He VBD rapid changes in DT NN were being fueled by 10 “ flatteners ” ( things IN DT end of communism , Netscape , outsourcing , etc. ) which in turn were amplified by he VBD were four “ steroids ” : Digital , Mobile , Personal and Virtual . Those four steroids actually turned out to be six – changing or extending DT terms of his imagery midstream is a classic Friedmanism – and DT sixth “ steroid , ” JJ wireless devices , was actually a JJ group of steroids he called “ uber-steroids . ” This was confusing because DT tenth item in Friedman ’s list of “ flatteners ” was DT group of four steroids . So his last flattener was a JJ group of steroids and his last steroid was a JJ group of uber - steroids . Which meant PRP had uber - steroids amplifying steroids amplifying flatteners , with each list comprising items WDT belonged to other lists . He mashed all of DT together for 470 pages or so . Eleven NNS and countless columns later , DT JJ book Thank PRP for Being Late takes DT same structure and boldly complicates PRP . This book is built , again , around DT idea IN technological NN is advancing beyond our ability to adapt . DT culprits this NN are three great “ Accelerations ” : Moore ’s Law ( microchip processing power doubles every 18 to 24 months ) , DT market ( globalization ) and Mother Nature , which is his English - language term for DT English - language term , “ NN NN and biodiversity loss . ” These Three Accelerations in turn are transforming five key “ realms , ” which he lists as “ DT workplace , politics , geopolitics , ethics , and DT community . ” If PRP ’re wondering what ’s left over when PRP subtract , from DT subset of all things , “ DT workplace , politics , geopolitics , ethics , and DT community , ” PRP ’re on to something . Because PRP turns out IN DT book is about how something is happening to – everything ! “ In short , ” Friedman says , in DT opening chapter of Late , “ this book is CD giant column about DT NN today . ” Incidentally , whenever Friedman uses DT phrase , “ In short … ” he ’s about to take DT short form of an idea and make PRP longer , e.g . “ In short , DT only way for Mexico to thrive is with a strategy of reform retail WDT will enable PRP to beat NNP to DT top , not DT bottom , because NNP is not focused on beating Mexico as much as PRP is on beating America . ” To his credit , in Thank PRP for Being Late , Friedman debuts DT use of , “ To make a short story long , ” which is n’t exactly fixing DT problem . But PRP is funnier . So how giant is this JJ giant column ? Really giant . EX are n’t enough drugs in DT NN to VB anyone through Thank PRP for Being Late in CD sitting . Take DT chapter about Mother Nature , which opens with a story about a day in July , 2015 when DT heat index in southern Iran reached 163 degrees . DT NN item gives DT author an opening to introduce DT concept of a “ black elephant , ” an ominous ( if PRP VBP Friedman ) term apparently explained to him by environmentalist Adam Sweidan : “ [ PRP is ] a cross between a ‘ black swan ’ – a rare , low - probability , unanticipated event with enormous ramifications – and ‘ DT elephant in DT room ’ : a problem WDT is widely visible to everyone , yet IN no NN wants to address , even though PRP absolutely VBP IN CD day PRP will have vast , black - swan - JJ consequences . ” PRP MD VB he MD just say , “ DT NN NN problem is a cross between a black swan and DT elephant in DT room – or , as I VBP to call PRP , a Black Elephant . ” Instead he leads audiences through drawn - out explanations of two everyday terms . Moreover his unnecessary definition of “ DT elephant in DT room ” contains DT phrase “ black swan , ” making what was originally a relatively simple idea now a kind of circular movie - within - a - movie image WDT is more than a little hard to follow : “ A black elephant is a cross between a black swan event and DT elephant in DT room , which is an ignored but visibly obvious problem WDT will inevitably become a black swan event . ” PRP ’re still grappling with DT when PRP learn “ EX are a herd of environmental black elephants out RB . ” Friedman names at least four : JJ NN , deforestation , ocean acidification and mass biodiversity extinction . He quotes Sweidan as saying of these : “ When PRP hit , PRP ’ll claim PRP were black swans WDT no NN MD have predicted , but in fact PRP were black elephants , very visible right now . ” Friedman just got finished telling PRP IN a black elephant is half black swan , and half elephant in DT room WDT will inevitably become a black swan . I am renewed . ” # 3 – Light your incense or oil burner , selecting a scent WDT brings PRP a feeling of calm and serenity . # 4 – Light your candle , placing PRP either next to PRP on DT floor or nearby on DT table if PRP are sitting up to a table . # 5 – Close your eyes and select a symbol , either a triangle , circle or heart . If PRP are sitting up to a table , make sure IN your feet are flat on DT floor in order to ground yourself throughout DT remainder of DT ritual . In DT same way , if PRP are seated on DT floor , find a position WDT leaves PRP feeling ground and secure . # 8 – Place CD hand over your heart , another on your belly . DT exact location will be guided by your intuition . Close your eyes , taking 10 deep breaths . Thank PRP . ” # 17 – This is DT end of your ritual . Blow out DT candle to finish . text: Spoiler alert : DT NNP is not flat . DT VBN , DT topic is certainly a fresh NN for Twitter beef . NNS have recognized DT curvature of DT NNP for more than 2,000 NNS . But rapper B.o.B. challenged DT view on Sunday when he began tweeting images and diagrams WDT he VBD were proof DT NNP is as flat as a 45 . Did PRP mention B.o.B. is promoting a JJ album ? Well he is . But he insists those things are definitely not related . So far , B.o.B. -- nee Bobby Ray Simmons -- has posted almost 50 images of DT supposedly flat NN , along with quotes from DT 2014 book “ DT Flat NNP NNP ” by Eric Dubay . PRP ’ve been tremendously deceived ” and “ I question DT international laws WDT prevent PRP from exploring Antartica and DT North Pole ... what ’s EX to hide ? ” Usually , when a prominent scientist steps forward to set DT record straight , DT ’s DT end of DT conversation . ( Actually , PRP ’s not . ) Then , in a move B.o.B. probably did n’t see coming , Tyson dropped a diss track back at him . DT rapper Tyson was referring to was his nephew , Steve Tyson , who goes by “ Tyson . ” He wrote and recorded DT song “ Flat to Fact . ” In an interview with DT Times , Tyson DT rapper VBD he came up with DT idea of writing a song in his famous uncle ’s defense after texting with him Tuesday morning “ I recorded PRP in my living room , ” Tyson VBD . “ I wrote PRP in a couple hours and just hit record and started recording PRP as a track . ” His uncle recorded himself reading some of his tweets to use in DT song . text: Detail from Nicolaes Visscher , Novissima et Accuratissima Totius Americae Descriptio , c . 1658 ( plate 1 ) . Over DT course of DT early modern period , DT ‘ space ’ of DT Netherlands opened up in several productive ways . Perhaps most famously , DT Dutch created DT JJ space of DT Republic : viable political space , demarcated from an older collection of provinces , which had been gathered most recently under DT auspices of DT king of Spain . DT Dutch RB expended tremendous effort reconstituting DT physical space of DT Low NNPS : land reclaimed from NN and increased urban centres , which allowed DT Republic to grow in population and gain in arable terrain . And DT Dutch enlarged their commercial and colonial space by dint of their numerous overseas expansions : a ‘ NNP ’ Netherland ( almost always referred to in singular form ) , which arose on DT eastern shores of what was already then called North America ; a modern ‘ Batavia ’ , which emerged in present‐day Indonesia ; and a host of Dutch forts and settlements WDT otherwise dotted DT coasts and islands of Asia , Africa and DT Americas . DT Dutch RB developed , just as famously , JJ pictorial devices to engage with space – DT painterly and printerly techniques explored in this issue – and , not unrelated , JJ techniques to map spaces : DT most robust cartographic ateliers of early modern Europe , which developed first in Antwerp and then in Amsterdam from DT late sixteenth century , coincident with DT rise of DT Dutch Republic and DT Golden Age of Dutch visual culture . Maps proliferated in DT early modern Netherlands . PRP offered a means both to delineate space and to narrate space – to explicate how space works and to assert where their makers ( and consumers ) fit within these spaces . Yet maps were RB important and ubiquitous material objects in DT Netherlands , which occupied myriad additional spaces and which played with DT JJ spatial and material concerns of their viewers . PRP engaged viewers and enticed them into their interpretive spaces . How do Dutch maps work , and what does this reveal about DT visual culture of DT early modern Netherlands ? These questions were famously tackled by Svetlana Alpers in DT Art of Describing mostly in regard to landscape painting . Yet in JJ ways , her influential essay on ‘ DT Mapping Impulse in Dutch Art ’ – DT NN ‐to source for non ‐Dutch specialists , particularly historians of NN who seek to affiliate their concerns with habits of natural ‐history representation with a broadly northern European tradition of painting – curiously avoided DT key to this intriguing interpretive palace : DT maps themselves and how PRP actually function . 1 While Alpers ’ oft‐cited chapter does open with Vermeer 's Allegory of Painting and DT impressive wall map by Claes Jansz . Visscher WDT amply fills its background , maps are otherwise relegated to DT side , treated sparingly and elliptically at best – at least DT form of artfully designed , lavishly embellished and meticulously printed maps WDT enjoyed such phenomenal popularity in DT Netherlands from DT late sixteenth through at least DT early eighteenth century . Maps do matter , and , as Alpers astutely points out , cartographic materials played a significant and instructive role in DT visual , social and indeed DT political culture of DT early modern Dutch Republic . PRP were ubiquitous in more ways than CD : as décor in houses and paintings ; as devices of learning and social standing ; as NN of cultural and political messaging . In a vital sense , however , these roles remain conspicuously absent in her analysis , inadequately problematized and not at all ‘ deconstructed ’ – to invoke DT language of DT JJ critical cartography WDT was being developed precisely when Alpers was formulating her insights into Dutch visual culture . 2 Maps as productive sources ( as opposed to theorized ‘ impulses ’ ) are only lightly glossed in Alpers ’ essay , their most superficial features brought to bear on a , by contrast , highly sophisticated argument about forms of ‘ mapped ’ landscapes ( as she terms PRP ) , best exemplified by DT flat panoramic paintings of Philips Koninck . This inverted theoretical focus distorts our perspective of Dutch ( and other ) maps and relegates to DT periphery an enormously dynamic visual source in DT early modern Netherlands . PRP RB irons out – unnecessarily – DT stimulating complexities of cartographic sources and DT promising possibilities of Alpers ’ implied query : what do maps offer to scholars of Dutch visual culture ? Rather than a ‘ flat working surface ’ , a Dutch map of this period was typically dense and jagged , presenting DT viewer with multiple angles of interpretive entry , as DT essays of this issue show for other NN and genres . Rather than offering a ‘ detached or perhaps even … culturally unbiased view ’ – can such a source ever be possible ? – these profusely layered artefacts furnish critical insight into and material evidence of DT visual culture WDT Alpers aims to address . 3 Early modern maps are delightfully thick objects and fundamentally material things . PRP illustrate modes of representation and craft , and PRP encourage various points of vision and interpretation . As PRP turns out , maps are anything but ‘ flat ’ . PRP richly demonstrate , in their own way , DT ‘ picturing impulse ’ of early modern Dutch culture . This brief intervention aims not so much to argue with Alpers as to consider a part of her argument WDT was left relatively under‐scrutinized : DT workings of Dutch maps . My goal is less to analyse how these maps work – EX is a vast and expanding literature WDT does just that4 – or even how PRP work in DT context of early modern Dutch painting , but rather to explore DT qualities of cartographic design WDT might speak to DT thematics of seeing and sensing pictures , so IN PRP might contribute , in this way , to DT broader understanding of Dutch visual culture WDT this issue sets out to explore . Maps are indubitably thick : PRP gesture relentlessly toward their materiality and to DT challenge their makers face in rendering into two dimensions what begins as three – DT same challenge confronted by Dutch painters , as several of DT essays gathered here so elegantly argue . Maps are theatrical : PRP stage JJ space in a profusely embellished form – PRP rarely offer mere , austere ‘ description ’ – and PRP dramatize for their viewers ways of processing both DT lands and waters of DT NN and DT things and events WDT occur within them . And – as this might imply – maps are narrational : PRP narrate spaces , frame histories and posit polemics – much IN Baroque theatre , to be sure , yet RB IN genres of painting of DT period , both in DT Netherlands and elsewhere . To demonstrate a few of these qualities , I turn , naturally , to a map : Nicolaes Visscher 's immensely popular Novissima et Accuratissima Totius Americae Descriptio ( first edition c . 1658 ; plate 1 ) , published more or less contemporaneously with Vermeer 's Allegory of Painting ( c . 1666–68 ) . Visscher 's printed map has an impressive history , VBG backward and forward , and touching as well DT key cartographic source of Alpers ’ inquiry . 5 Its original author was DT only son of Claes Jansz . Visscher , DT well ‐regarded cartographer who engraved DT wall map depicted in DT Vermeer Allegory . DT Visscher family RB had ties by marriage to DT illustrious Hondius firm , makers of DT Mercator atlases through DT first half of DT seventeenth century – PRP were thus kinsmen of mapping aristocracy – and their atelier in Amsterdam on DT Kalverstraat placed them in DT thick of all things cartographic . DT younger Visscher followed in his father 's professional footsteps and enjoyed considerable success , especially with his map of DT Americas . DT Americae went through several editions , RB in revised forms engraved by other ( sometimes competing ) ateliers ; PRP was appropriated for geography books , both as an insert and ( in a distilled form ) as a frontispiece ; and PRP was routinely copied and pirated outright , extending its successful run well into DT eighteenth century . 6 PRP became perhaps DT single most important early modern map of DT western hemisphere and certainly CD of DT most recognized images of DT NNP NNP . Its allegorical ( lower ) cartouche , moreover , became DT all ‐but standard representation of ‘ America ’ , an iconic image WDT crossed easily into other genres and NN . Nevertheless , despite its prestigious lineage and its titular promises of ‘ novelty ’ and ‘ accuracy ’ , DT map succeeded not so much for its exacting ‘ description ’ as for other , arguably pictorial reasons : for its highly embellished and appealing presentation of DT NNP NNP . DT actual cartographic content of DT map – DT particular delineations of DT lands and seas of DT western hemisphere – was scarcely JJ . PRP derived mostly from older materials , chiefly Joan Blaeu 's 1648 map of DT NN ; DT outlines of DT continents of these two maps are nearly identical . This habit of replication was not at all uncommon in early modern Dutch cartography ( as in other graphic arts ) , especially in DT sort of lavishly ornamented charts WDT became DT mainstay of Amsterdam ateliers . Nor can DT Visscher map make great claims for geographic meticulousness : a prominent ‘ California ’ floats off DT western coast of America , an island of DT mapmakers ’ imagination ; DT Great Lakes blend into CD truly great lake , which leaks its contents into DT Atlantic ; and DT long ‐sought Northwest Passage is offered optimistically as readily accessible , an open NN flowing freely into Asia . DT map 's promise of novelty and accuracy , in other words , is rhetoric – again , a fairly common ploy in early modern mapping ( as in late modern advertising ) . No Baconian empiricism here , but rather strategies WDT relate to DT techniques of rhetoric – pervasive across myriad Renaissance fields of enquiry – and to DT crafty practices of DT workshop . What likely sold DT map , more than its less ‐than ‐meticulous ‘ description ’ of DT continents , MD have been DT staging of DT Americae and DT ample ‘ adornments ’ WDT enriched Visscher 's product : DT four‐legged staffage WDT wander DT open , ultimately uncharted spaces of DT map ( what J. B. Harley famously called its ‘ silences ’ ) ; DT ethnographic vignettes WDT explicate DT NNP NNP 's indigenes ; and , not least , DT superb cartouches WDT fill DT upper and lower divisions of DT vast Pacific Ocean , at once distilling and framing DT continents in terms of space and narrative . 7 DT charming ‘ creatures in DT map ’ – these did not VB out of style in DT Renaissance – MD have appealed to a range of consumers . 8 Two handsome stag deer saunter across DT terrain of Eastern Canada ( Nova Francia on DT map ) ; PRP MD appear to await DT hunter 's arrow just as do DT tame deer of Ben Johnson 's poetic Penshurst or any other exemplary country house . A fox gambols across DT Great Plains ( a scene likewise redolent of DT Northern European countryside ) ; and beavers , coveted lately by Dutch merchants for their valuable pelts , pose obediently just inland of DT plainly demarcated empire of Nieu [ NNP ] Nederland .9 Further afield a pair of brown bears inhabit DT open , wild west ; meanwhile , a lone anteater has South America largely to himself . DT two‐legged staffage of tropical America – DT is , DT indigenous Americans – do no hunt any exotic fauna , but CD another . Their depiction in DT interior of Brazil , naked and engrossed in brutal warfare , offers a synoptic view of DT ‘ savage ’ Indian , here imagined as uncivilized if RB unobtrusive . As for DT pair of cartouches , CD occupying DT upper left and DT other DT lower left portion of Visscher 's print , these serve as DT dual anchors of DT map , DT dominant pictorial elements and DT keys to DT artefact 's interpretation ( plate 2 and plate 3 ) . PRP RB function to stage DT map 's motifs and – crucially – to elucidate its overall message . PRP is here IN both DT theatrical and narrative impulses of Dutch mapping come through most vividly and most pictorially . Both cartouches follow designs by Nicolaes Pietersz . Berchem , a highly regarded landscape painter , as PRP turns out ( and DT only son of Pieter Claesz , a master of still ‐life painting ) , who specialized in a form of idealized Italianate scenes popular in DT period ( a subgenre of Dutch landscape WDT lay conspicuously beyond Alpers ’ scrutiny as putatively un ‐Dutch ) . 10 DT pair of map vignettes work as an ensemble – DT device of DT parasol lures DT viewer 's eye from DT vignette below to DT balancing scene above – yet PRP is DT iconic figure of America herself , who gracefully gestures to DT map 's ‘ carved ’ title , WDT lies at DT heart of DT visual programme . Berchem at once allegorized and condensed DT essential qualities of DT cartographic space . He packed PRP all in : DT alluring personification of ‘ America ’ , decked out in a dainty feathered skirt and colourful feathered headdress ; DT pearls , barely visible around her neck , demonstrating DT region 's endemic richness ; DT classic bow and arrow , just to her right , alluding to her habit of hunting ( America RB bears a stylized club ) ; DT mounds of freshly mined gold ( or perhaps silver ) piling up at her feet , alongside stacks of ingots WDT indicate DT substantial mineral wealth of DT continent ; a pair of queerly coiled snakes , which reveal DT exotic naturalia of DT NNP NNP ; and DT central parasol , which shades America 's head from DT tropical sun.11 DT sum of DT parts tells DT story of DT whole : a massively rich , vaguely exotic , not ‐quite‐tamed NNP NNP . DT upper cartouche furnishes another allegory , which introduces a different angle on America , yet CD WDT is thematically complementary . A cluster of figures surrounds and supports a free‐floating , shield ‐like device , which bears a patron 's coat of arms and DT map 's dedication ( to Cornelius Witsen , a major supporter of overseas trade and exploration , on DT original NN , yet this varies with different printings ) . 12 DT predominant figure of this cluster , a European woman hovering in DT very upper‐left corner of DT map , represents Christian Faith : relatively plainly dressed , she points didactically with CD hand to a cross WDT she holds in her other hand and positions directly above DT other figures . She glances not to DT cross , however , but to a broad ‐shouldered , sharp‐taloned , demon ‐like figure below , who tumbles out of DT sky : an allegory of diabolism , ejected by DT Christian Church . An angel opposite and above gazes , mouth agape , at this falling devil and DT wondrous turn of events , while another heavenly figure , just to DT angel 's left , announces per clarion DT plunge of diabolism and DT spread of DT gospel . Finally , an Indian – DT figure situated closest to DT American landmass who wears DT same feathered headdress as DT principal ‘ American ’ figure of DT lower cartouche , in this way linking DT two vignettes – gazes in astonishment at DT allegory of Faith , whose good works have apparently converted him . DT cartouche recounts , in short , DT Church 's labours in DT NNP NNP : its presumed successes casting out false faiths and diabolisms , and evangelizing among DT American indigenes .13 To say IN these vignettes are staged is to identify both DT drama of Faith 's triumphs in DT NNP NNP and DT several marks of theatricality WDT hold DT ensemble together . DT parasol does this formally : not only does PRP lure DT eye upward , but PRP points directly to DT upper Indian ; were he to fall from DT sky , he might pierce himself on DT parasol 's tasselled spike . DT parasol functions , further , as a clever stage prop , a showy accoutrement WDT establishes DT ostentatious tropicality of America ( DT point of DT parasol abuts DT very words ‘ Tropicus Capricorni ’ ) . In fact , bona fide parasols commonly served as props in Baroque theatre ; and a particularly famous example of this , DT engraving of Anne Bracegirdle in her popular role as ‘ DT Indian Queen ’ , alludes subtly to DT Berchem allegory of America : feathers , pearls and parasol render DT renowned Restoration actress adequately ‘ exotic ’ . 14 Theatrical motions – of hands and other limbs – RB lend DT joint cartouches a dramatic , balletic cogency : arms akimbo on either side of DT title slab , hands gesturing instructively by DT allegorical figures both above and below , and DT scissoring feet of Christian Faith and her Indian protégé alike all serve to animate DT scene . DT swirling dress of Faith , swept up by DT heavenly winds , and her billowing and entirely theatrical shawl ( since this prop MD have been utterly extraneous in DT heavens ) suggest , yet again , tricks of DT stage – and , of course , of highly painterly composition . All of these devices heighten DT drama of DT map and thereby elucidate DT meaning of America . And all of these devices might RB prompt DT question : what is DT message of DT map and DT narrative arch WDT bridges Berchem 's upper and lower cartouches ? DT bond between Faith and America harks back to a proverbial wisdom WDT circulated in late medieval and early modern Europe about DT inverse relation of ‘ god ’ and ‘ gold ’ : wherever DT latter flowed abundantly , PRP was proposed , DT former was typically scarce ( and DT reverse ) . Such a conception of America and her endemic riches ‐cum ‐heathenism justified much of Habsburg Spain 's early colonial action in DT NNP NNP – DT conquest and simultaneous conversion of DT Indians . Yet PRP RB carried an implicit moral message , which gained traction among critics of DT Habsburg Conquista , especially in Northern Europe . And here PRP need to turn to a text , CD of JJ WDT MD have helped viewers read Visscher 's map . A late sixteenth ‐century poem , which captioned DT Dutch and German editions of an engraved allegory of America , commented poignantly on this contradictory relationship between DT European god and American gold ( words WDT punned even more in DT original : god and goud in Dutch ) : Here DT wondrous mineral wealth of America fosters her own decline ; she goes from benighted idolatry to miserable slavery . DT sixteenth ‐century allegory ( engraved by Adriaen Collaert after a design by Maarten de Vos ) expresses sympathy for DT doubly abused Indians . In DT Visscher map , however , with its relatively neutral ‐looking figure of Faith , not obviously Catholic nor Protestant , and with its pan‐colonial vision of DT Americas – NNP France , NNP Netherlands , and English ‐settled Virginia are all engraved into DT space , no less than DT nomenclature of Iberian colonial possessions in South America – DT message pertains to European colonialism and European exoticism writ large . DT map spells out DT evangelical and imperial rise of DT Old NNP in DT NNP . A map , however , even while PRP MD possess plentiful text and even while PRP might be read as and with DT help of text , is certainly not identical to text – PRP is textual and pictorial , not to mention cartographical . PRP is RB material , of course , and while EX MD have been textual and iconographic foundations for such maps as Visscher 's , EX were RB unmistakable evocations of craft and materiality . DT heritage of early modern Dutch cartography goes back not so much to Ptolemy , as Alpers argues , as to DT pioneering labours of Gerard Mercator and Abraham Ortelius , who drew on DT traditions of late ‐medieval mapping – highly pictorial and allegorical products , typically emanating from DT workshops of master illuminators – and on DT NN of craft . 16 Ortelius instinctively placed geography in DT context of art : famously in relationship to history ( ‘ Historiae oculus geographia ’ ) , yet RB in DT sphere of drama . 17 His Theatrum orbis terrarrum not only summons DT language of DT stage , but RB greets its audience on its engraved title page with a recognizable proscenium ( plate 4 ) . Mercator – whose posthumously published atlas RB adapted DT symbols of theatre on its title page – sprang more directly from DT milieu of craft . His main source of income in his early professional NNS came from DT fabrication of mathematical and navigational instruments – this placed him in DT vibrant , metal ‐working ateliers of northern Europe – and , for JJ of DT early cartographic projects with which PRP associate him ( his work with Gemma Frisius and Gaspar à Myrica , for example , on their terrestrial globe ) , he served as a highly skilled engraver of brass plates . He was RB an innovator in DT production of commercial globes ; and he was a remarkable italicist , who composed , designed and printed DT first instruction book of italic script published north of DT Alps . He mastered math and craft , art and ‘ NN ’ . More to DT point , DT actual , tangible maps of Mercator and Ortelius VBP out of their way in these early NNS to emphasize their affiliation with modes of craft and material arts . Both mapmakers ’ ateliers , in producing DT first generation of ‘ craft maps ’ – this is DT geographer John Pickles ’ term for DT highly pictorial , thickly ornamented maps WDT developed in DT late sixteenth ‐century Netherlands18 – make habitual reference to DT process of their maps ’ production and to DT material arts whence PRP came . Thus does Mercator 's Orbis Terrae Compendiosa Descriptio make literal reference to its maker 's background in brass ‐work by DT depiction of an armillary sphere in DT upper centre of DT map 's design , while RB making more figurative allusions to metalwork in DT strapwork surrounding DT armillary ; in DT elaborate fretwork bearing DT JJ hemispheres ; and in DT clever metallic tooling of DT engraved frame WDT encases DT NN map ( plate 5 ) . These devices serve to emphasize DT ‘ thickness ’ of early modern cartography – its broader project of converting three ‐dimensional space into two – while RB invoking DT material arts with which Mercator ( and JJ map illuminators before him ) sought to affiliate himself . Thus , too , does Ortelius offer CD of his most celebrated cartographic images – Abrahami Patriarchae Peregrinatio et Vita ( 1590 ) , which charts DT life and journeys of DT Old Testament patriarch Abraham , DT mapmaker 's namesake – as a trompe l'oeil WDT invokes DT illustrious art of tapestry ( plate 6 ) . Meanwhile , several other graphic techniques make more subtle gestures to various other material arts : twenty ‐two circular medallion vignettes , so ‐called since PRP evoke DT bronze medallions much in fashion at DT NN , do DT heavy ‐lifting narration of Abraham 's life ; two superb cartouches display DT map 's textual apparatus and once again reference DT art of strapwork ( DT interior sample with garlands being a particularly fine example of DT genre ) ; and two decorative masks – ‘ hung ’ on a strapwork cartouche , which is ‘ fastened ’ to a cartographic tapestry – not only lend a sense of depth to this already densely materialized map , but RB allude to DT NN of theatre . DT map , in short , offers a tour de force of spatial manipulation – to VB along with its textual and pictorial narration . Some three ‐quarters of a century later , Nicolaes Visscher and Nicolaes Berchem likewise expended considerable effort in thickening their map . PRP collaboratively layered several illusions of space in DT Americae engraving . Careful hatching around DT edges of DT continents and scattered islands lends a sense of depth to DT hemisphere , a quality further enhanced by DT ‘ shadows ’ cast by DT ships at NN and DT animals on shore ( see plate 1 ) . This imparts to what otherwise might be perceived as flat geographic space DT property of density , and PRP grants DT map 's viewers an optical sense of verticality , as if PRP were observing DT continents from an elevated , almost atmospheric altitude . DT swirling figures of DT upper vignette induce a dizzying lateral movement yet further up ; PRP are now in DT skies , if not quite DT heavens , where shadow and wind still persist ( see plate 3 ) . DT curling ( upper ) cartouche , which carries DT map 's dedication on DT form of a wooden shield , RB plays with DT materiality of DT shield : a shield bears a shield , as PRP were . In DT lower vignette , space moves more horizontally . Here EX is a quality of earthiness , as opposed to DT lofty airiness above , and DT conceit WDT DT ground slopes downward along with DT figures behind DT ‘ slab ’ of cartouche who recede gently into DT horizon ( and presumably further into DT subterranean mines from where America 's gold and silver originate ) ( see plate 2 ) . And if wind animates DT upper scene , DT sun plays DT role below , casting shadows over DT figure of America , thereby RB accentuating DT tropical heat of DT land . DT parasol , DT most tangible of accessories of DT tropics and theatre alike , stylishly shields ‘ America ’ from DT elements , and in this way RB pulls DT narrative spaces together . Craft maps , a genre developed outstandingly in DT picture‐rich culture of DT early modern Netherlands , drew from DT arts of painting and engraving , and from DT fields of geography and DT material arts . Their form owed much to DT practices of ateliers : to printerly habits of delineating and ‘ describing ’ , to be sure , yet RB to modes of narrating and embellishing space , of crafting and thickening maps . Indeed , within DT intricate matrix of early modern Dutch workshops , DT makers of maps borrowed as well as loaned ; images from cartographic sources and geography books moved from printed NN ( textual as well as iconographic ) , yet RB to material arts . ‘ America ’ MD redeploy over DT coming decades from maps to forms of tapestry , ceramic ( especially porcelain , once Europe mastered its own techniques of production ) , lacquer ‐ware , cut glass , and so on , as DT image steadily gained in popularity . Visscher 's cartographic images , in other words , moved from DT two ‐dimensional space of DT map back to DT three ‐dimensional space of DT decorative arts from where Mercator and Ortelius had drawn their earlier inspiration . Both DT lineage and DT influence of ‘ craft ’ maps are rich in numerous ways . Early modern Dutch maps are anything but mere ‘ description ’ , and PRP most certainly illustrate , pace Alpers , abundant ‘ pictorial marks of [ social and political ] authority ’ . CD PRP illustrate and narrate and dramatize much more , and much WDT speaks rather productively to Alpers ’ and our concerns with Dutch visual culture . For maps such as those produced by Visscher and his contemporaries ask PRP – just as other prints and paintings do – to VB about space and its representation . Dutch maps use graphic forms and pictorial devices to stage space and to present DT drama of space from multiple angles and perspectives . Visscher 's map , complemented by Berchem 's vignettes , displays DT drama of European expansion from up high and down low , from DT fauna‐rich interiors of DT American continents to DT ship ‐peppered seas WDT surround them . PRP invokes DT tricks of theatre – rhetoric and gesture , evocation and insinuation , props and propaganda – to narrate space , in this case DT spaces of European conquest , colonialism and empire . And PRP narrates DT space in assorted ways , just as history narrates and as other textual and pictorial genres narrate : to be DT eye of history is not necessarily to be wholly mute ( or purely descriptive ) . PRP does all this , again as other visual sources do , as a means to entice its viewers . DT Americae beckon in myriad ways : Berchem 's figure of ‘ America ’ seduces its viewer with her opulent pearls and exotic feathers , tactile prompts of supreme allure ; Visscher 's sheet map invokes multiple registers of materiality , encouraging an intense sense of touch , depth and space ; and DT Americae , of course , arouse wide ‐ranging colonial desires , which surely reached across to several early modern European aspirants of imperial worlds . text: DT Great Pyramid is a true masterpiece and has rightly earned DT title of a “ Wonder ” . PRP was built with such precision WDT our current technology cannot replicate PRP . Historical analysis shows IN DT Pyramids were built between 2589 and 2504 BC . EX are so JJ interesting facts about this Pyramid WDT PRP baffles archaeologists , NNS , astronomers and tourists . DT Pyramid of Menkaure , DT Pyramid of Khafre and DT Great Pyramid of Khufu are precisely aligned with DT Constellation of Orion . 03 . DT outer mantle was composed of 144,000 casing stones , all of them highly polished and flat to an accuracy of 1/100th of an inch , about 100 inches thick and weighing approx . 15 tons each . 06 . DT cornerstone foundations of DT pyramid have ball and socket construction capable of dealing with heat expansion and earthquakes . 07 . DT mortar used is of an unknown origin ( Yes , no explanation given ) . PRP has been analyzed and its chemical composition is known but PRP ca n’t be reproduced . PRP is stronger than DT stone and still holding up today . 08 . PRP was originally covered with casing stones ( made of highly polished limestone ) . PRP are no longer present being used by Arabs to build mosques after an earthquake in DT 14th century loosened JJ of them . DT east / west parallel WDT crosses DT most land and DT north / south meridian WDT crosses DT most land intersect in two places on DT NN , CD in DT ocean and DT other at DT Great Pyramid . 11 . [ 270.45378502 Pyramid Inches* 10^8 = 427,316 miles ] 23 . DT curvature designed into DT faces of DT pyramid exactly matches DT radius of DT NN . 24 . text: Browsing through history , PRP ’s very clear IN DT NN has undergone JJ monumental shifts in society WDT have uprooted PRP ’s very foundation in place of JJ seed . A paradigm shift is a fundamental NN in approach or underlining assumptions . For example , when Pythagoras proposed IN DT NNP was round instead of flat , DT foundation of NN and NNS ’s understanding of DT NN was completely changed . Similarly , when DT Industrial Revolution took place EX was a complete shift in manufacturing , lifestyle , and economics . A paradigm shift can literally shake a society to its core , taking PRP off its current path and putting PRP on a brand JJ NN . Though PRP might appear DT opposite in DT corporate controlled mainstream NN , PRP appears IN DT entire NN is in DT very early stages of a paradigm shift . These shifts take place in JJ of DT worlds most basic elements and redefine how life functions . Here are 8 signs DT NN is undergoing a paradigm shift : 1. DT Power of DT Internet and DT Age of Information DT Internet is arguably DT greatest invention in DT history of man . Never in our known history has man had access to such a broad range of diverse information from all over DT NN at DT tips of his fingers . JJ forget IN DT Internet has only really been commercialized in DT west since DT early 1990 ’s and its spread across DT NN has n’t even come close to peaking yet . DT Internet is undoubtedly giving rise to DT Age of Information as NNS become more awake to what ’s really VBG on in DT NN . A multitude of information is now accessible if PRP knows where to look . NNS can now learn JJ skills or hear different versions of DT truth in mere minutes . DT Internet is not only giving rise to an open access of information , but communication is almost instantaneous all over DT NN . PRP is paramount IN DT Internet remain an open decentralized system in which everyone can freely add and operate if this paradigm shift is to continue . PRP feeds almost all other shifts . 2. DT Ascent Of DT Independent Non-Corporate Online NN Thanks solely to DT Internet , DT rise in independent journalism has taken off . Alternative NN has become an increasingly popular choice for those wishing to stay truly informed , especially younger generations . NNS are continually switching off cable NN ( cable TV all together ) , and instead resorting to online sources . While mainstream NN is still DT number CD source of current NN events for DT masses , DT tide is slowly changing as NNS are awakening to DT fact IN corporate sponsored NN is mostly propaganda and half - truths . War is becoming much harder to justify as independent journalists have shined DT light on what DT powers WDT be never wanted anyone to see . A prime example is DT conflict in Syria in which DT establishment , despite DT lack of popular support , so desperately wanted to start a war IN when DT rebels PRP were funding used chemical weapons , PRP was then blamed on DT Assad NN to protect their investment and design . Thanks to independent journalists , a war has so far been averted since PRP was revealed IN DT U.S. was in bed with DT rebel groups and PRP was DT rebels who used DT chemical weapons . This JJ faction of journalism will give peace a legitimate chance as all dirty laundry is now being aired and corrupt alliances exposed . This in turn has allowed JJ NNS to deprogram from DT countless NN PRP have taken in over DT NNS and see DT NN through a clearer lens in which DT truth is more evident . Though PRP will never be broadcast on mainstream NN , DT real threat of a U.S. dollar collapse as DT NN reserve currency is very real . DT paradigm of central bank controlled economies WDT can issue credit and zero percent interest rates through nearly unlimited printing of money backed by nothing is an illusion WDT is beginning to break down . PRP ’s not just DT U.S. dollar WDT ’s under threat , but JJ other central currencies such as DT Euro and Yen . Massive equity bubbles are being blown up by this cheap credit along with massive debt WDT will be nearly impossible to pay back with DT current economies in which only DT very elite benefit . JJ NNS are waking up to DT fact IN , IN all other bubbles , these bubbles will burst and PRP are beginning to break away from DT dollar . Examples include DT buildup of a JJ central bank in DT emerging economy of DT BRICS group , DT countless NNS passing trade agreements in which bypassing DT U.S. dollar ( including agreements in oil ) , and DT persistent selling of treasury stocks by DT Chinese NN who quite often are DT last resort buyer of U.S. debt . Not only has EX been a shift in DT pecking order of fiat paper currencies , but decentralized crypto-currencies IN Bitcoin are threatening DT very system of fiat money and DT centralized control a select few elite have on DT system through central banks . This MD shift power worldwide . 4. DT Rise of DT Peer - to - Peer Economy A Peer - to - Peer ( P20 ) Economy is a de-centralized model whereby two individuals interact to buy or sell goods and services directly with each other , without intermediation by a third - party , or without DT use of a company or business . PRP see this being used by companies IN Air BnB , Uber , Craigslist , Sidecar , and Dogvacay among others . Often referred to as a sharing economy , EX is no centralized control of power , allowing NNS to more directly profit from their goods / services rather than pay unnecessary middlemen along DT way . This is a trend WDT is sure to grow as technology makes PRP easier for NNS to make PRP on their own and allows for NNS to own their means of production and finished goods , instead of just being paid in DT production process . DT peer - to - peer economy is RB possible through DT abundance of goods already out RB , allowing for goods to be shared and recycled rather than thrown away and reproduced . Not only is DT peer - to - peer economy growing , but JJ young NNS are ditching DT career 9 - 5 jobs and branching off into independent careers or job hopping . DT top down business model in economics has now found a legitimate system in which a decentralized bottom up approach gives DT power back to DT NNS . DT shift towards renewable NN is a forgone conclusion as renewable NN is DT way of DT future . In fact , DT shift looks to be happening faster than NNS realize . According to DT NNP NNP Initiative , “ Numerous scenarios projected levels of renewable NN for 2020 WDT already were surpassed by 2010 . ” DT IEA VBZ IN , “ In 2012 , DT NN relied on renewable sources for around 13.2 % of its total primary NN supply , and in 2013 renewables accounted for almost 22 % of JJ electricity generation . ” With increased technological capabilities along with ever - growing concern over DT NN of DT environment , DT NN is beginning to not only shift towards renewables , but DT power over NN supplies and grids is decentralizing . For example , home solar panels or DT JJ Tesla Powerwall , MD enable NNS to access their own NN directly from DT sun without VBG through middlemen . Another example is a local city IN Burlington , VT being DT first city in DT U.S. to use 100 % renewable NN ; even whole NNS IN Paraguay , Iceland and Norway being 100 % renewable . Cheap localized NN is on DT horizon along with DT very real possibility Nikola Teslaonce envisioned , which is a NN of free NN . DT reemergence of organic food is not only on DT rise , but DT use of farmers markets and locally grown food is on DT rise as well . According to DT Non GMO project , “ In more than 60 NNS around DT NN , including Australia , Japan , and all of DT NNS in DT European Union , EX are significant restrictions or outright bans on DT production and sale of GMOs . ” DT rise is so strong IN according to DT Organic Trade Association , “ Supply shortages [ of organics ] are CD of DT greatest challenges facing DT industry today . Despite continued growth in production , handlers are not able to keep up with demand . ” Thanks in large part to DT Internet and non-corporate sponsored research , NNS are beginning to understand DT importance behind knowing exactly what ’s in DT food CD consumes and how PRP directly correlates to NN . This has put mounting pressure on food businesses to adapt . DT signs are already evident as Chipotle sees their profits increase while operating completely Non-GMO , while sales giants such as McDonalds see profits continue to decrease amidst NN concerns over their food . JJ are beginning to truly care what goes into their body and DT rise of localized non-organic food in this country is a direct result of this NN - conscious shift . 7. DT Understanding Of a NN of Abundance As Gandhi famously VBD , “ DT NN has enough for every man ’s needs , but not for every man ’s greed . ” NNS are finally awaking to DT fact IN EX is enough to VB around , just not with DT current systems in place . No NN is saying EX is enough for everyone to live at current western consumption rates , however with adoption of renewable NN , JJ forms of decentralized NN and economics , and DT increase in DT usage of technological capabilities , EX is more than enough for everyone in DT NN to live happily . For example , DT NN produces enough food for 10 billion NNS , yet JJ VBP starving as a result of faulty systems of distribution . Another example is NN ; EX is more than enough NN on DT NN , but PRP ’s DT JJ systems WDT VBP in DT way of technology . DT notion of scarcity has long haunted DT systems of NN and economics , but now a JJ paradigm of abundance is beginning to take root in DT minds of NNS . DT Venus project is a prime example of an alternative resource based economy in which sustainability and resource supply are taken into account . A NN of abundance with zero emission is no longer just a pipe dream , but MD very well become a reality as NNS VBP in terms of abundance . Finally a consciousness shift is underway in which NNS are starting to see themselves as more than just individual NNS operating in an isolated bubble , but instead as a connected piece in DT collective consciousness of NN NNP . DT Internet , along with DT increased capacity for travel , has allowed NNS from all over DT NN to connect . So JJ parts of DT JJ society have become interconnected and NNS are beginning to take notice of not only their own country , but NNS abroad . JJ are beginning to realize IN CD group of NNS suffering means everyone is suffering . This interconnection to everything has given rise to practices such as meditation , yoga , and travel , as well as DT continued JJ acceptance towards mind altering organic substances IN marijuana and mushrooms . NNS are beginning to emotionally connect to life all over DT NN and not just their immediate home and surroundings . This JJ reality is showing NNS IN EX is more to life than money , as connection to all living things is equally , if not more , valuable . As PRP can see , DT NN is very much in DT early stages of a shift in consciousness and design . These shifts are leading to a growing decentralization movement in which DT power controls of society are taken from DT few and given to DT JJ . Obviously , EX is a very strong force at play WDT is fighting against this paradigm shift . This force is fighting for centralization of power in almost all facets of life . EX can be no doubt of DT presence of this resistance when PRP examines DT ever - increasing wealth and power gap WDT is out of control in this country . DT actions taken by these elite organizations are getting more radical and desperate by DT day . With all DT being VBN , DT JJ paradigm shift has CD advantage WDT I believe will be DT game changer , and DT ’s DT will of DT NNS . This is not just DT NNS of a a single country , but internationally , as VBN JJ movements such as Occupy Wall street , DT Arab Spring , and March Against Monsanto are happening simultaneously all over DT NN around central causes . So wake - up and participate , for PRP are in DT early stages of a revolutionary paradigm shift in DT consciousness of DT masses WDT can truly VB society for DT better . An avid free - thinker , Tim has set out on a mission in search of DT truth in whatever form PRP MD come . Ever since his awakening several NNS ago , his passion for knowledge and justice has led him on a journey into deep research , cultural travel , and complete expansion of DT mind . Tim feels as if DT information freely flowing into DT hands of DT NN , due to DT dawn of DT Internet , cannot be stopped at this point , so he has made PRP his goal to help facilitate and breakdown this complex stream of information , so IN others can accelerate their own awakening and be part of DT inevitable NN happening in society . text: A carbon tax is paid by businesses and industries WDT produce carbon dioxide through their operations . DT tax is designed to reduce DT output of greenhouse gases and carbon dioxide , a colorless and odorless incombustible gas , into DT atmosphere . DT tax is imposed with DT goal of environmental protection . A tax designed to mitigate or remove DT negative externalities of carbon emission , a carbon tax is a type of Pigovian tax . Carbon is found in every kind of hydrocarbon fuel ( including coal , petroleum , and natural gas ) and is released as DT harmful toxin carbon dioxide ( CO ) when this kind of fuel is burned . CO is DT compound primarily responsible for DT " greenhouse " effect of trapping heat within DT NNP 's atmosphere , and is , therefore , CD of DT primary causes of JJ NN . A carbon tax is RB referred to as a form of carbon pricing on greenhouse gas NNS where a fixed price is set by DT NN for carbon NNS in certain sectors . DT price is passed through from businesses to consumers . By increasing DT cost of greenhouse NNS , governments hope to curb consumption , reduce DT demand for fossil fuels , and push more companies toward creating environmentally - friendly substitutes . A carbon tax is a way for a NN to exert some control over carbon NNS without resorting to DT levers of a command economy , by which DT NN MD control DT means of production and manually halt carbon NNS . Any carbon found in manufactured products IN plastics WDT is not burned is not taxed . DT same applies to any CO WDT is permanently isolated from production and is not released into DT atmosphere . But DT tax is paid during DT upstream process , or when DT fuel or gas is extracted from DT NNP . Producers can then pass on DT tax to DT market by as much as PRP can . This , in turn , gives consumers a chance to reduce their own carbon footprints . Carbon taxes have been implemented in a number of NNS around DT NN . PRP take several different forms , but most amount to a straightforward rate of taxation per ton of hydrocarbon fuel used . DT first country to implement a carbon tax was Finland , in 1990 . DT levy currently stands at $ 24.39 dollars per ton of carbon . DT Finns were quickly followed by other Nordic NNS — Sweden and Norway both implemented their own carbon taxes in 1991 . Starting at a rate of $ 51 per ton of CO used in gasoline ( DT tax MD later decrease considerably ) , DT Norwegian tax is among DT most stringent in DT NN . Most forms of carbon taxation have been deployed successfully , but Australia 's failed attempt from 2012 - 2014 stands in stark contrast . DT minority Green party was able to broker DT carbon tax during a period of political stagnation in 2011 , but DT tax never garnered DT support of either of DT main parties in Australia , DT left - leaning Labor Party ( which reluctantly agreed to DT tax to form a NN with DT Greens ) and DT center - right Liberals , whose leader Tony Abbott spearheaded DT 2014 repeal . IN most JJ initiatives to combat NN NN , carbon taxes remain highly controversial .

text: Can DT Weather Affect My Child 's Asthma ? Yes . Weather conditions can bring on asthma symptoms . Some kids ' asthma symptoms VBP worse at certain times of DT NN . For others , a severe storm or sudden weather NN can trigger a flare - up . Cold , dry air is a common asthma trigger and can cause bad flare - ups . DT 's especially true for NNS who play winter sports and have exercise - induced asthma . Hot , humid air RB can be a problem . In some places , heat and sunlight combine with pollutants to create ground - level ozone . This kind of ozone can be a strong asthma trigger . Wet weather and windy weather can cause problems too . Wet weather encourages mold growth , and wind can blow mold and pollen through DT air . If PRP VBP weather plays a role in your child 's asthma , keep a diary of asthma symptoms and possible triggers and discuss them with your doctor . NN NN , waning habitat will drive NN Researchers are n't clear yet about how DT novel NN began infecting NNS , but say PRP seems to have originated in bats , making PRP DT latest in a string of emerging human NN WDT spread from animals . NN and wildlife experts say PRP expect to see a rise in diseases transmitted among animals , plants and humans , and in particular , more frequent outbreaks in humans of diseases WDT come from animals . Such " zoonotic " diseases already make up DT majority of JJ infections in humans . But animals are n't to blame for DT increase in JJ outbreaks , according to Arizona NNP University virologist Arvind Varsani . Humans are . Varsani researches DT emergence of diseases around DT globe and he VBD two major factors likely to impact DT dynamics of NN spread are NN NN and changes in land use due to urbanization or agriculture . Both factors put animals under strain , forcing them to compete for resources in shrinking habitats and making them opportune hosts for zoonotic diseases , which more easily infect stressed animals . Shrinking suitable habitat amid urbanization and DT rapid expansion of agriculture RB cluster animals closer together with humans and domestic animals . DT allows DT viruses to jump from CD host to DT next . “ PRP stress these animals and DT means PRP ’re creating an environment for viruses to succeed , where in most NNS DT viruses MD ’ve been put to check , " he VBD . " And with DT , everyone is in very , very close proximity to each other , so what PRP ’ve got is CD event — and PRP only need CD event to take off — and DT next thing PRP VBP , PRP 's spilling over . ” And sometimes , DT viruses spill over into humans . Researchers RB detected an increase in DT rate of JJ , emerging infectious diseases , according to DT report . In DT case of DT novel NN , DT source is believed to be a market in Wuhan , NNP , WDT sold both dead and live animals . Arizona Game and Fish wildlife veterinarian Anne Justice - Allen VBD IN veterinarians and NN experts strongly recommend against having markets IN these , which can be densely packed , difficult to keep clean , and pose a higher risk of viruses jumping from animals into humans . Other well - known examples of zoonotic diseases WDT impact humans are West Nile NN , HIV , Ebola , Zika , bird NN , Middle East respiratory syndrome , or MERS , Rift Valley fever , and sudden acute respiratory syndrome , or SARS . On average , CD JJ infectious NN emerges in humans every four months , according to DT UNEP report , but not all are this severe . “ While PRP is very uncommon for diseases in animals to suddenly jump and become so transmissible between NNS as this NN did , DT more PRP do DT sort of thing , mixing animals together ... then DT more likely IN NN is VBG to be able to jump into NNS and become transmissible between NNS , " Justice - Allen VBD . With NN NN effects such as drought , increasing temperatures and wildfires , Justice - Allen VBD animals will be forced to move to JJ areas . FIGHTING NN : Using robots to speed up testing , ASU hopes to open drive - thru NN testing VBG JJ temperatures are increasing DT habitat ranges of some insects WDT transmit diseases from CD organism to another , such as mosquitoes or ticks . NN is RB lengthening DT season in which these insects can survive in some areas , leading to a boom in their population . DT increased range and abundance of vectors MD lead to more widespread NNS of mosquito - and tick - borne diseases such as malaria , West Nile NN , dengue fever , chikungunya , Zika , and Lyme NN , according to Heidi Brown , an ASU researcher who studies vector - borne diseases . Arizona is CD of 16 NN grant recipients creating a BRACE plan as part of DT CDC's NNP - Ready NNPS and Cities Initiative . " PRP have to be prepared for DT known , which is increases in DT stuff WDT PRP 're already seeing , but PRP RB have to be prepared for DT unknown , which is novel introductions , " she VBD . In Arizona , known diseases such as West Nile NNP are likely to become a bigger concern , and MD spread into JJ areas of DT NN outside of Maricopa County , Brown VBD . " Flagstaff does n't typically VB about or worry too much about West Nile NNP , and PRP do n't usually have a lot of NNS up RB , but EX 's evidence WDT suggests IN PRP might need to start making sure IN PRP 're watching for PRP , " she VBD . Factors IN drought can RB cause vectors to cluster around NN sources alongside of animals , leading to further mixing and further possibilities for JJ diseases spread in vectors . Another bridge between humans and animal diseases is domestic animals , according to Bernard Bett , a scientist at International Livestock Research Institute . Around DT NN , Bett VBD agriculture is increasingly encroaching on wild lands , bringing humans and domestic animals closer to wild ones and disturbing DT natural ecosystem . But domestic animals have been bred in such a way IN PRP lack DT genetic diversity needed for NN resilience and can then pass DT infection on to humans . CD example is DT bird NN , which moved from wild birds into domestic poultry before being passed to humans . Demand for milk and meat " driven mainly by fast - growing populations of urban consumers in developing NNS , " is projected to double by 2050 , according to DT UNEP report , meaning IN DT problem is likely to VB worse as agricultural demand expands . Urbanization RB can encroach on wild lands , Varsani VBD , and DT means humans are coming into increased contact with animals — creating another potential avenue for NN transmission . Increased zoonotic NN spread MD RB have devastating effects on animals , especially those already at risk from other NN NN effects . “ PRP have a number of endangered species here in Arizona which are kind of on DT edge when PRP comes to being able to respond to JJ stressors , " Justice - Allen VBD . But EX 's always DT possibility for unknowns — for JJ diseases to show up unexpectedly — especially in tight living conditions . text: DT JJ average atmospheric carbon dioxide in 2018 was 407.4 parts per million ( ppm for short ) , with a range of uncertainty of plus or minus 0.1 ppm . Carbon dioxide levels today are higher than at any point in at least DT past 800,000 NNS . In fact , DT last NN DT atmospheric CO amounts were this high was more than 3 million NNS ago , when temperature was 2°–3 °C ( 3.6°–5.4 °F ) higher than during DT pre-industrial era , and NN level was 15 – 25 meters ( 50 – 80 feet ) higher than today . Carbon dioxide concentrations are rising mostly because of DT fossil fuels WDT NNS are burning for NN . Fossil fuels IN coal and oil contain carbon WDT plants pulled out of DT atmosphere through photosynthesis over DT span of JJ millions of NNS ; PRP are returning DT carbon to DT atmosphere in just a few hundred NNS . Squeeze or stretch DT graph in either direction by holding DT Shift key while PRP click and drag . DT bright red line ( source data ) shows monthly average carbon dioxide at NOAA 's Mauna Loa Observatory on Hawai'i in parts per million ( ppm ) : DT number of carbon dioxide molecules per million molecules of dry air . Over DT course of DT NN , values are higher in Northern Hemisphere winter and lower in summer . DT dark red line shows DT annual trend , calculated as a 12 - month rolling average . According to DT NN of DT NNP in 2018 report from NOAA and DT American Meteorological Society , JJ atmospheric carbon dioxide was 407.4 ± 0.1 ppm in 2018 , a JJ record high . DT is an increase of 2.5 ± 0.1 ppm from 2017 , similar to DT increase of 2.2 ± 0.1 ppm between 2016 and 2017 . In DT 1960s , DT JJ growth rate of atmospheric carbon dioxide was roughly 0.6 ± 0.1 ppm per NN . Over DT past decade , however , DT growth rate has been closer to 2.3 ppm per NN . DT annual rate of increase in atmospheric carbon dioxide over DT past 60 NNS is about 100 times faster than previous natural increases , such as those WDT occurred at DT end of DT last NN age 11,000 - 17,000 NNS ago . Carbon dioxide is a greenhouse gas : a gas WDT absorbs and radiates heat . Warmed by sunlight , NNP ’s land and ocean surfaces continuously radiate thermal infrared NN ( heat ) . Unlike oxygen or nitrogen ( which make up most of our atmosphere ) , greenhouse gases absorb DT heat and release PRP gradually over NN , IN bricks in a fireplace after DT fire goes out . Without this natural greenhouse effect , NNP ’s average annual temperature MD be below freezing instead of close to 60 °F . But increases in greenhouse gases have tipped DT NNP 's NN budget out of balance , trapping additional heat and raising NNP 's average temperature . Carbon dioxide is DT most important of NNP ’s long - lived greenhouse gases . PRP absorbs less heat per molecule than DT greenhouse gases methane or nitrous oxide , but PRP ’s more abundant and PRP stays in DT atmosphere much longer . And while carbon dioxide is less abundant and less powerful than NN vapor on a molecule per molecule basis , PRP absorbs wavelengths of thermal NN WDT NN vapor does not , which means PRP adds to DT greenhouse effect in a unique way . Increases in atmospheric carbon dioxide are responsible for about two - thirds of DT total NN imbalance WDT is causing NNP 's temperature to rise . Another reason carbon dioxide is important in DT NNP system is IN PRP dissolves into DT ocean IN DT fizz in a can of soda . PRP reacts with NN molecules , producing carbonic acid and lowering DT ocean 's pH . Since DT start of DT Industrial Revolution , DT pH of DT ocean 's surface waters has dropped from 8.21 to 8.10 . This drop in pH is called ocean acidification . A drop of 0.1 MD not seem IN a lot , but DT pH scale is logarithmic ; a 1 - unit drop in pH means a tenfold increase in acidity . A NN of 0.1 means a roughly 30 % increase in acidity . Increasing acidity interferes with DT ability of marine life to extract calcium from DT NN to build their shells and skeletons . Natural increases in carbon dioxide concentrations have periodically warmed NNP ’s temperature during NN age cycles over DT past million NNS or more . DT warm episodes ( interglacials ) began with a small increase in sunlight due to a tiny wobble in NNP ’s axis of rotation or in DT path of its orbit around DT Sun . DT little bit of extra sunlight caused a little bit of NN . As DT oceans warmed , PRP outgassed carbon dioxide — IN a can of soda VBG flat in DT heat of a summer day . DT extra carbon dioxide in DT atmosphere amplified DT initial NN . Based on air bubbles trapped in mile - thick NN cores ( and other paleoclimate evidence ) , PRP VBP IN during DT NN age cycles of DT past million NNS or so , carbon dioxide never exceeded 300 ppm . Before DT Industrial Revolution started in DT mid-1700s , DT JJ average amount of carbon dioxide was about 280 ppm . By DT NN continuous observations began at Mauna Loa Volcanic Observatory in 1958 , JJ atmospheric carbon dioxide was already 315 ppm . On NNP 9 , 2013 , DT daily average carbon dioxide measured at Mauna Loa surpassed 400 ppm for DT first NN on record . Less than two NNS later , in 2015 , DT JJ amount went over 400 ppm for DT first NN . If JJ NN demand continues to grow and to be met mostly with fossil fuels , atmospheric carbon dioxide is projected to exceed 900 ppm by DT end of this century . Collins , M. , R. Knutti , J. text: Melbourne , 25 June 2012 : Australian infectious NN therapy and NN development company BioDiem Ltd ( ASX : BDM ) announced today DT signing of a licensing agreement with Australian National University ( ANU ) . This agreement is for an exclusive JJ license to commercialise a novel NN technology from DT John Curtin School of NNP Research at ANU . Dengue Fever is DT lead indication , but DT technology MD RB facilitate DT design of NNS against a number of other infectious diseases including Murray River encephalitis and Japanese encephalitis . DT increasing incidence of mosquito - borne NN is a major NN concern worldwide as NN NN expands DT range of DT carrier mosquitoes , exposing larger human populations . DT agreement includes provision for BioDiem to sublicense DT technology . Industry standard royalties apply , but apart from a small contribution towards patent registration costs EX is no up - front outlay for BioDiem . DT agreement follows DT signing of a term sheet announced to DT ASX on 6 June 2012 . Dengue Fever is a NN caused by a mosquito - borne NN WDT affects between 50 and 100 million NNS a NN , and according to DT NNP NNP Organization DT incidence is increasing significantly . Although only a small percentage of NNS are fatal , non-fatal NNS can be extremely debilitating . Dengue Fever currently has no existing NN , and control methods currently include attempts to address mosquito populations with varying effectiveness . DT technology is complementary to DT BioDiem portfolio as well as DT company 's strategic focus on NNS and therapies for infectious diseases and related cancers . " PRP are delighted to announce DT completion of this licensing agreement , which sees BioDiem 's commercial expertise in DT area of NNS fittingly partnered with DT exciting research developed by ANU . Our focus on infectious diseases is an excellent fit for this JJ technology which has strong potential as an asset for outlicensing " VBD BioDiem CEO Julie Phillips . BioDiem 's current strategy for DT ANU technology includes leveraging DT company 's JJ partnering network to deliver an outlicensing partner for development of DT technology , providing an opportunity to secure a royalties stream without significant development costs on DT part of BioDiem . BioDiem is an ASX - listed company based in Melbourne with an international focus on discovering , developing and commercialising NN - class research and technology targeting cancers and infectious diseases . BioDiem 's core technologies include DT Live Attenuated Influenza NNP ( LAIV ) , DT SAVINE platform and DT BDM - I antimicrobial compound . DT LAIV influenza NN is an intranasal NN to prevent infection from seasonal and pandemic influenza . DT LAIV influenza NN can be produced using both egg - based and cell - based manufacturing methods . DT cell - based LAIV NN has completed a Phase II clinical trial in Europe . DT egg - based LAIV NN technology is licensed to DT NNP NNP Organization as part of DT NNP Pandemic Influenza Action Plan to Increase NNP Supply . DT LAIV influenza NN is marketed as Nasovac™ in India by DT Serum Institute of India , and has been licensed to NNP - based Changchun BCHT Biotechnology Co . DT LAIV NN was in - licensed from DT Institute of Experimental Medicine in St Petersburg , Russia where PRP has been used for over a decade in JJ millions of NNS - NNS , adults and DT elderly . DT LAIV is administered by nasal spray and induces a rapid immune response in DT mucosal lining of DT nose and pharynx . DT LAIV is RB being developed as a viral vector for making novel non-influenza NNS for different diseases including cancers . Viruses have DT ability to generate proteins prolifically and can be programmed to produce NN - specific proteins . As part of a NN , NN - specific proteins can help generate a beneficial immune response . SAVINE ( patented Scrambled Antigen NNP ) is a platform technology for DT design of antigens for incorporation into NNS targeting an immune response to a range of different diseases . SAVINE antigens are encoded as synthetic genes which , together with a delivery technology such as BioDiem 's LAIV - based NN vector technology , can be used to develop novel NNS . BDM - I is a synthetic compound targeted at DT treatment of serious human infections . BDM - I is in DT preclinical stage with outlicensing as DT intended outcome . BDM - I is active against a range of pathogenic micro-organisms including gram - positive and gram - negative bacteria , fungi and protozoa . Key patents have been filed around BDM - I 's antimicrobial activity , including for activity against Plasmodium falciparum , responsible for causing DT most commonly severe form of malaria , and Trichomonas vaginalis , DT protozoan responsible for causing a common sexually transmitted NN named trichomoniasis . BioDiem is RB developing BDM-E , a tetra peptide synthetic compound , as a treatment for ophthalmic disorders . DT NNP Food & Drug Administration ( USFDA ) has granted Orphan Drug designation to BDM-E for DT treatment of retinitis pigmentosa , a serious degenerative NN of DT retina . BioDiem 's research is ongoing in partnership with internationally recognised laboratories . For additional information , please visit www.biodiem.com

text: In addition to DT already existing pressure on our freshwater resources , NN NN MD further decrease NN availability . In this NN , projections of future NN resources , due to NN NN , land use NN and changes in NN consumption have been assessed using JRC ’s LISFLOOD NN resources model . DT results presented are based on 11 NN models which project current and future NN under two Representative Concentration Pathways ( RCPs ) : RCP4.5 and RCP 8.5 emission scenario . RCP4.5 MD be viewed as a moderate - NNS - mitigation - policy scenario and RCP8.5 as a high - end NNS scenario . A 30 - NN window around DT NN IN JJ NN reaches 1.5 oC , 2 oC and 3 oC above preindustrial temperature has been analysed and compared to DT 1981 - 2010 control NN window ( baseline ) . DT 1.5 °C and 2 °C NN scenarios are explicitly considered in DT Paris Agreement , while a 3 °C JJ NN is a scenario WDT MD be expected by DT end of DT 21st century if adequate mitigation strategies are not taken . First , PRP performed future projections without socio-economic developments to show DT effect of NN NN only . Next , an integrated assessment is performed including future changes in land use , NN demand and population . This allows PRP to disentangle DT effects of NN and socio-economic changes . In general , DT NN projections reveal a typically North - South pattern across Europe for NN availability . Overall , Southern European NNS are projected to face decreasing NN availability , particularly Spain , Portugal , Greece , Cyprus , Malta , Italy and Turkey . Central and Northern European NNS show an increasing annual NN availability .
